newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Nellcor jumps.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Nellcor jumps.

text.p: Medical product supplier Nellcor Puritan Bennett Inc surged before markets opened Thursday after it agreed to be bought by Mallinckrodt Inc in a deal valued at $1.9 billion.
Nellcor's shares were trading at 28-3/16, up from a Wednesday close of 20-15/16, a trader said. They earlier had traded at 27-3/4.
Under the merger deal announced after the markets closed Wednesday, Mallinckrodt is to buy Nellcor for $28.50 a share in cash.

Among other active shares, Digital Equipment Corp was trading at 42-1/2, up from a Wednesday close of 40. The company reported a fourth-quarter profit of $0.75 a share, slightly above a First Call consensus estimate.
Microsoft Corp was trading at 138, down from a close of 141-7/16, and Dell Computer was at 163-3/4 from a closing price of 164.

Swedish telecommunications equipment maker Telefon AB L.M. Ericsson was trading at 46-1/8 from a close of 41-12/16. The company reported sharp jump in first-half earnings and a $200 million contract with a BellSouth Corp unit.
Fellow Nordic telephone equipment maker Nokia Group was trading at 82-1/4 from a close of 87-8/16. Motorola Inc also rose, to 80 from a close of 79-5/16.
CVS Corp was trading at 54-1/2 from a close of 54 after the company reported a second-quarter operating profit of $0.52 a share compared with $0.44 for the same period last year.
